data.title: July Events in Kent County
data.meta_description: Short Attention Span Theatre June 30, July 7 • 2 p.m. The Garfield Center for the Arts at the Prince Theatre – 210 High Street, Chestertown Short Attention Span Theatre, the Garfield’s own 10…
data.text:
Short Attention Span Theatre

June 30, July 7 • 2 p.m.

The Garfield Center for the Arts at the Prince Theatre – 210 High Street, Chestertown

Short Attention Span Theatre, the Garfield’s own 10-minute play festival, completes its 15th year on July 7. Produced by Mark Sullivan and Diane Landskroener, “SAST” runs weekends through July 7. An audience favorite, SAST features the local talents of dozens of directors, writers and actors, and is designed to hold your attention for Just. Long. Enough. For tickets, call 410-810-2060, email events@garfieldcenter.org or visit garfieldcenter.org.

Mainstay Monday

July 1 • 7 p.m.

The Mainstay, 5753 Main Street, Rock Hall

This week features Joe Holt at the piano and guest Griffith Kazmierczak. Each week is a unique show. Cash bar. Doors open at 6:30 p.m. Call 410-639-9133.

Fireworks

July 3 • Dusk

The Rock Hall Bulkhead, Bayside Avenue, Rock Hall

Be treated to one of the best and most popular fireworks displays in the region. Call 410-639-7719.

Hometown Parade

July 4 • 10 a.m.

Main Street and the Civic Center, Rock Hall

Experience an old-fashioned, hometown parade along Rock Hall’s Main Street, featuring the Kent County Community Band, floats, horses, antique cars, fire engines and more. The parade starts at the Lagoon Ballfields on Route 445. The parade is followed by activities in the Civic Center on Civic Center Drive and includes food vendors, arts and crafts and other family-oriented activities.

First Friday

July 5 • 5-8 p.m.

Downtown Chestertown

First Friday is a free event sponsored by Chestertown’s downtown merchants, community organizations, and art galleries along Park Row, High Street, Cross Street, and Cannon Street. This event is held the first Friday of every month. Call 443-282-0246 for details.

“Patterns of Eastern Shore Life” Exhibit

July 5 • 5:30-8 p.m.

RiverArts, 315 High Street, Suite 106, Chestertown

The new exhibit, “Patterns of Eastern Shore Life,” features an opening reception on July 5. Artists were challenged to interpret “patterns” broadly, capturing the beauties and wonders of rural Eastern Shore life. The exhibit is on display July 5 through 28. For more information, visit chestertownriverarts.net.

CD Release Party

July 5 • 8 p.m.

The Mainstay, 5753 Main Street, Rock Hall

Mainstay stalwart Chuck Redd brings an all-star band to The Mainstay to celebrate the release of his new CD “Groove City.” Cost is $35 at the door. Visit mainstayrockhall.org.

KidSPOT!

July 6, 13, 20, 27 • 9 a.m.-Noon

RiverArts, Chestertown

KidSPOT is a hands-on creative learning center for children aged two to 12 open every Saturday free of charge to kids accompanied by an adult. The center is a destination for area children where they can look forward to interacting with a variety of stimulating activities that expand their horizons. Located right next door to the RiverArts galleries, KidSPOT invites children to play, create and explore the arts and sciences. Kids participate in activities that incorporate visual arts, performing arts, literary arts, music, science and technology. Call

410-778-6300 for details.

Farmers’ Market

July 6, 13, 20, 27 • 8 a.m.-Noon

Fountain Park, Chestertown

Purchase homegrown produce, herbs, cut flowers and plants as well as breads and soaps, and hand-crafted works of local artisans. For more details, visit “Chestertown Farmers Market MD” on Facebook.

Mobile Veterans Center

July 9 • 10 a.m.-2 p.m.

North Commons Student Parking Lot off Morgnec Road, Washington College, Chestertown

The Vet Center Program offers a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to combat veterans, active duty military members and their families. All services are free of cost and are strictly confidential. Call 410-778-7888.

Garfield Improv Group

July 9, 23 • 8-10 p.m.

Garfield Center for the Arts at the Prince Theatre, Chestertown

The Garfield Improv Group offers actors, writers, and creative thinkers the opportunity to develop and grow their individual voice and technique through improvisation. Each week, the group will focus on elements such as initiating a scene, how to approach a character, making strong character choices, establishing and recognizing character status, and heightening a scene. There will be many opportunities to perform (or watch) each week and the bar will be open. Email improv@garfieldcenter.org or call 410-810-2060.

Second Saturdays in Chestertown

July 13 • 3-7 p.m.

Bad Alfred’s Distilling, Cannon Street Parking lot between Cross and Mill streets, Chestertown

Live music, amazing food and drink, and fun for everyone. This event is held rain or shine.

Guests of all ages are welcome to attend. There is plenty of free public parking. For more information, call 443-282-0246.

Cars on High

July 18 • 6-8 p.m.

300 Block of High Street by Fountain Park, Chestertown

Every third Thursday evening through October automobile enthusiasts bring their classic, antique or custom cars downtown to share with other car-heads and the public. Purchase food from Smoke, Rattle and Roll food truck or try some of Lockbriar’s ice cream. This event is held weather permitting. Call 410-778-2991.
